description.narrative: Increased national capacity and delivery of services to ensure children protection from violence, abuse and exploitation in humanitarian situations are sustained and promoted

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased national capacity and delivery of services to ensure children protection from violence, abuse and exploitation in humanitarian situations are sustained and promoted

description.narrative: Through collaboration with partners including the Department of the Child and Family of the Ministry of Human Rights, Social Affairs and Gender, UNICEF provided access to critical protection services to 39,361 vulnerable children (25,551 boys and 12,810 girls) and contributed to the improvement of sectoral coordination including at field level. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018

title.narrative: Percentage of districts that have an information management system that is inter-operable and supports and tracks case management, incident monitoring and performance monitoring (humanitarian)
# of children benefiting from child protection services in humanitarian situations
Availability of a functioning national coordination mechanism for child protection in humanitarian situations
